Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence or credible source provided to verify the statement made by President Trump about the condition of the White House bunker.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Obama is responsible for the alleged bad condition of the White House bunker without providing any evidence or justification for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that President Trump was only in the White House bunker for an hour on May 29, 2020, while the tweet in question implies it was sent on May 31, 2020.
Understate: The claim may understate the seriousness of the security concerns that led to President Trump being moved to the bunker, as it was described as one of the highest security alerts in the White House complex since the 9/11 terrorist attacks.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the condition of the White House bunker, such as regular maintenance or other factors not mentioned in the claim.
